FuncDef:
The flow-mapping command creates a flow mapping object and displays the flow mapping view.
The undo flow-mapping command deletes a flow mapping object.
By default, a default flow mapping objects is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a flow mapping object.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The flow mapping object defines the mapping from the CoS of flows in the subscriber queue to the CoS for the flow to go into the class queue.
Configuration Impact
If the specified mapping- name does not exist, the system creates a new flow mapping object.
If the specified mapping- name exists, the system enters the flow mapping view, under which you can modify the flow mapping.
Precautions
There are a maximum of 16 flow flow mapping objects in one system. One object the default one, and the other 15 objects can be created by users.
There are a maximum of 32 flow flow mapping objects can be configured in all systems.
The flow mapping objects that are applied by user-queue cannot be deleted.
This command is supported only on the following boards and takes effect only when the board is not equipped with an eTM subcard: CR53LPUF50A, CR57LPU50B, CR57LPUF50C, CR57LPUF100C, CR57LPUF120A, CR57LPUF240A, CR57LPUF240F.
